span.title: Base StructureDefinition for Timing Type: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

definition.value: Action to occur as part of plan cpl-3: Provide a reference or detail, not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

short.value: Results of the activity Binding: CarePlanActivityOutcome (example): Identifies the results of the activity.

definition.value: Results of the activity Binding: CarePlanActivityOutcome (example): Identifies the results of the activity.

short.value: Activity details defined in specific resource

definition.value: Activity details defined in specific resource

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

short.value: Appointment or CommunicationRequest or DeviceRequest or MedicationRequest or NutritionOrder or Task or ServiceRequest or VisionPrescription Binding: CarePlanActivityKind (required): Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

definition.value: Appointment or CommunicationRequest or DeviceRequest or MedicationRequest or NutritionOrder or Task or ServiceRequest or VisionPrescription Binding: CarePlanActivityKind (required): Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

short.value: Detail type of activity Binding: ProcedureCodes(SNOMEDCT) (example): Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

definition.value: Detail type of activity Binding: ProcedureCodes(SNOMEDCT) (example): Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

short.value: Why activity should be done or why activity was prohibited Binding: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings (example): Identifies why a care plan activity is needed. Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

definition.value: Why activity should be done or why activity was prohibited Binding: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings (example): Identifies why a care plan activity is needed. Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

short.value: not-started or scheduled or in-progress or on-hold or completed or cancelled or stopped or unknown or entered-in-error Binding: CarePlanActivityStatus (required): Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

definition.value: not-started or scheduled or in-progress or on-hold or completed or cancelled or stopped or unknown or entered-in-error Binding: CarePlanActivityStatus (required): Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

short.value: If true, activity is prohibiting action

definition.value: If true, activity is prohibiting action

short.value: What is to be administered/supplied Binding: SNOMEDCTMedicationCodes (example): A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

definition.value: What is to be administered/supplied Binding: SNOMEDCTMedicationCodes (example): A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

short.value: Extra info describing activity to perform

definition.value: Extra info describing activity to perform
